result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan J Raikowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence being served

*Probation can be transferred to another county (Wood County), if defendant so wished and DOC approves
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Wood County Probation

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge 
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol (absolute sobriety) or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Randal and Shawn Zoromski, unless they request contact and it is approved by the agent 
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
*Provide DNA Sample

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan J Raikowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dylan J Raikowski in court with attorney William George Weiland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:13 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State will be amending the information to a class "b" misdemeanor disorderly conduct/domestic abuse.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification; no victims appear in Court today.  No victim impact statements provided to the State.
Atty Weiland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay jail sentence of 60 days - consecutive to any other sentence 
Placed on Probation for 12 months - concurrent to Wood County probation
Probation to be transferred to another county (Wood County), if defendant so wishes and DOC approves 
**Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Randal and Shawn Zoromski, unless they request contact and it is approved by the agent
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol (absolute sobriety) or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Provide a DNA sample 

20 days to appeal
/s/ RJS
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Record Update
filed by the State

Defendant Dylan J Raikowski not in court, defendant in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:27 p.m.  Court is in session and states the appearances.

Court gives the status of the case and elements of the case.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court questions the defendant as to why he failed to appear for his Court hearing.
Defendant responds.
Atty Constable states the charges for the defendant that he has pending in Wood County.

BTC:  NOT GUILTY plea entered.
Court questions defendant if he has an attorney in Wood County Case.
State is requesting a $200 cash bond with conditions as stated

Defendant is informed to get in contact with the public defender.
